Question: Patrick **** came to Boston, took a job as a migrant worker, and died within eight or nine years, of cholera.
Hints: After ****'s assassination, President Johnson passed NSAM 273 on November 26, 1963.
This person's initial reaction was to ignore this, as long as free access from West to East Berlin continued.
A Catholic, this person is the only non-Protestant president, and is the only president to have won a Pulitzer Prize.
